intro: Bourreria cumanensis, commonly known as the Cumanensis burr plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. It produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, often accompanied by bracts that resemble small leaves. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique floral structure.
